title: Finally done
text: after years of dealing with discrimination, terrible customer service, rates above market price, and a platform that puts its hosts above its guests, I just had my last negative experience. Verbo and hotels.com are better in every way.

title: Changing to a fraud company
text:
They don‚Äôt care anymore. 
Customer service will leave you hanging with no way to escalate issue to upper management. 

What are we suppose to do now

title: Unfair
text: I had decent experience with airbnb. My issue comes in with the ‚Äúreview‚Äù system. I don‚Äôt feel it is fair that the app urges us to give the host a good review or it won‚Äôt be posted, but the host can write a bad review about the customer and it gets posted with no issues. Plus we have to ‚Äúdispute‚Äù a negative review through support which takes forever if it even happens. It‚Äôs very dishonest and unfair to current and future users. All reviews about the host should be posted, good or bad because all reviews get posted about the customer no matter if it‚Äôs good or bad. I will not use the app anymore because of this. I deleted my account.

title: Terribly designed app
text:
Verification system threw up random error messages on browser when trying to verify phone number.
Then after I try on the app it says I can‚Äôt confirm for 24 hours?!
Talked to customer service representative but they were VERY unhelpful.

title: Not reliable, terrible customer service
text: I have used Airbnb for 6 years. On 4 different occasions I have booked an Airbnb 5+ months out from my scheduled trip and then had the hosts cancel on me right before. This year, Airbnb allowed the host to cancel on me 2 days before my trip leaving me to panic and scramble to find a new one. I tried numeorus times reaching out for assistance and got nothing in return. I can no longer rely on Airbnb, there is no point in booking one since hosts can cancel whenever. The hosts have too much power and Airbnb does nothing to protect or assist renters.

title: Horrible customer service
text:
Just felt bitter about recent encounter with Airbnb. I had an excursion planned in Europe and my flight was cancelled in Amsterdam‚Äôs ‚Äî thanks KLM. I didn‚Äôt make a flight and Airbnb would not try to workout a deal and charged $250+ even though it wasn‚Äôt our fault.
Peace, 
Max

title: Review
text: Idk what I would do without airbnb honestly ! Wether it's for traveling , work, vacation, or lifestyle good or bad! It's definitely worth booking through, no resort fees or security deposits !

title: Dishonest listings are common
text:
2 of the last 3 times I used AirBnB, the listings seriously misrepresented the property. One claimed to have 3 bathrooms; in actuality the property had only 1 toilet. The other claimed to be oceanfront / beachfront; in actuality it was ~1 or 2 blocks from the beach. (The 3rd one was honest and wonderful). 
I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll use AirBnB again. It‚Äôs a risk. Owners seem fine with making stuff up and AirBnB seems not to have any mechanism to ensure accurate listings, they try to get you to ‚Äúwork it‚Äù with the owner.

title: Beware of Airbnb
text:
When things go wrong your on your own.  They will not protect you and you will not get your money back, we call this a scam in business.  
What a joke.  They used to be good but now have no moral compass.  Sad.

title: Customer Service is useless
text: I had a host accept my alternate stay and she never refunded my money back. I called Airbnb Support and she didn‚Äôt respond to them. I lost out on $687.09 . The Customer Service is in India so you will not get any help with that either. If the host withheld your refund, the host can negotiate what they want to give back. This is company is not about the customer it‚Äôs about the host.

title: So expensive
text: I don‚Äôt know how people afford to book Airbnbs anymore. The fees are just out of control. Between the cleaning and booking fees, it‚Äôs literally half the price if you stay at a hotel.  Airbnb please reign this in and go back to basics. As far as the app, filtering options are limited‚Ä¶and quite inaccurate. If I search for waterfront, I‚Äôm not interested in your property that‚Äôs a 1 mi drive to the water. üôÑ

title: RUN FOR YOUR LIFE!
text: At lease at a hotel you can hold someone accountable and/or get a refund if the host doesn‚Äôt hold up their end of the deal. AirBnB does not have any interest in your complaints or concerns. The rental could be completely wrong, full of bugs, mold, and you will be stuck for the duration. Don‚Äôt take my word for it, just research AIRBNB nightmares and you‚Äôll find that this organization is completely corrupt and the hosts are more often than not dishonest in their listings and Airbnb does not verify that listings are as advertised. A scheme all the way to the top. I lost months of funds while traveling due to booking extended stays at a string of listings that fell very short of expectation, including the bugs and mold. It was too late once I realized that no matter what listing I ended up at, none of them were as advertised and the company told me too bad. Video evidence, pictures. Didn‚Äôt matter. They just assumed it was in bad faith. They tell you to settle it on site with the host. They‚Äôll tell you the host has THE ENTIRE DURATION of your stay to resolve the issue. Even if they make no effort to resolve the complaint, it still counts. RUN FOR YOUR LIFE.

title: Why hide addresses?
text: Why do you hide addresses? I‚Äôm trying to book a place and I want to look up on a map how close it is to trails. Your built in map doesn‚Äôt show the trails so I need the address to look on a trail map. In the end I didn‚Äôt book through this app. Hiding the address is shady! Hotels don‚Äôt hide their address. I booked a hotel instead! Completely stupid business model!

title: Cleaning Fee Ripoff
text:
The idea that Airbnb allows their host to charge crazy high cleaning fees is ridiculous. You should not be allowed to charge a daily cleaning unless you are cleaning daily!!!

Airbnb needs to get rid of the cleaning fees and let the hosts build that price into their rental rates - just like a hotel.

title: Not able to download
text: Why is it that I can‚Äôt use the app I have. If I can‚Äôt download new one it seems wrong to force me to upgrade to a new phone.

title: Expensive and predatory cleaning fees
text: Air bnb used to be a good option, but now since all air bnb‚Äôs charge $200 plus cleaning fees on top of all the other fees, and built in rules‚Ä¶. Requiring you to clean‚Ä¶. It lost its luster. At least at hotels you don‚Äôt have to clean and you also get free breakfast.

title: Terrible Robot based Customer Service
text: Airbnb used to be so much better - now the customer service is non existent, with any problems you will be speaking to a robot, and my last 3 cases I spent useless hours and nothing was ever resolved! Pull it together Airbnb! No more robots for customer service - give us Real and logical humans!

title: Trust & safety concerns
text: Limited trust and safety. Multiple scams ongoing related to insufficient host/ fraud checks. Constantly see reviews purporting scams and false placements.

title: So much trouble to book
text: Their host are always so awful. they all just wanna steal your money. horrible app do not recommend. They will try to charge you on top of the total price. overall a horrible app.

title: Welcoming? Not likely.
text: Worst experience staying somewhere of my life. $20/night apt and the hosts never settled on how to pay for it. Then pressed charges when stuff was missing from her apartment after I left it in perfect condition minus a used towel.

title: Rented Arthur's place unfortunately in Phoenix
text:
After arriving at Arthur's condo in Phoenix we requested to cancel because it was the most unsafe area we had ever tried to stay while using Airbnb. I consistently use this service while traveling for work. After the poor and lack of communication from air bnb I will most likely not use this service anymore. 
To give an example the parking lot of the condo and surrounding area was littered with drug addicts dealers and what seemed to be a tent city across the street. I highly recommend not staying here. I'm from the South Side of Chicago and didn't want to get out of the car if you know what I mean. 
There has been no support from air bnb and we will be contacting our credit card company for a refund.

title: Scum land lords
text: I came to the Airbnb service so that I would not have to worry about finding a place to live. I found 2 ads and both turned out to be fraudulent. How do you keep the service clean? I don't want to look anywhere for housing, I'm ready to pay extra for airbnb service. They are trying to deceive me, at first they tried to take me to their third-party site, then they say that the ad I chose is unavailable, the room is occupied, they offered another one for $ 300 more expensive. Well, I agreed, now they ask to be contacted by phone before confirming the reservation. I am dissatisfied with the Airbnb service, I will never use it again and I will not recommend it to anyone.

title: Totally unable to reserve anything
text: I‚Äôve had continual issues with Airbnb over the last year, I can never reserve anything with a vague ‚Äúsomething went wrong‚Äù error. Tried on multiple browsers and multiple devices until I inevitably get a ‚Äútoo many attempts message‚Äù.

title: Uninstalled
text: Too much expensive . Booking hotel seems to be better than Airbnb

title: DO NOT BOOK
text: I went to Spokane from Ohio for my sons, chemotherapy treatments me and my wife and my son, when we first got there, we booked under my wife‚Äôs account and ended up having to leave the first Airbnb. We were at because of family emergencies and they needed their home and so we booked a different day well the night after we got there I got a notification from our Host stating that Airbnb canceled our reservation and we needed to leave immediately. I didn‚Äôt understand why so my wife went into her account to check to see what happened and they completely removed her account and said that we were partying even though they had no proof or evidence because we weren‚Äôt. Well, we asked for a refund for the rest of the nights because we spent $900 and they kept saying they would escalate our case escalate. Our case never contacted us back never put the account back up and never gave us a refund for our money. Well, we went and booked an Airbnb under my name on my account and ended up getting robbed. All of our belongings got stolen and Airbnb helped us with rebooking we rebooked the Airbnb. We had the hot tub didn‚Äôt work so we wanted to go somewhere else. They issued us a coupon and the second they issued all those coupons to my account, they sent me an email stating they were removing my account from the platform for party risk of partying, again with no evidence and no warning at all and now they are refusing to talk to us at all and I just lost over $900 again which is totaling out to about $1900 that we‚Äôve lost within the last week and now they refuse to give us our accounts back or even a gift voucher with the amount on it so we could get somewhere else to stay. Do not book with Airbnb. They will scam you.

title: Host
text: Mario is been the best host you can ever find, this is the second time using his house and his responses are fast and efficient, thank you Mario

title: Update for new AIR BNB    March 2024
text:
I have been utilizing Air bnb since its inception and I will tell you that it is the hosts that define the quality of this product and not the app.  That being said, the Airbnb app is now the most convenient tool  to find alternatives to hotels in the travel biz.  I do find google search to run a close second to this app and find google infinitely easier to use- such that I find many Airbnb on google then get the details on Airbnb app.  

I still find Airbnb format, codes and operation extraordinarily ineffective in getting the whole picture.  Even many reviews reveal hidden codes as ‚Äúcozy bed‚Äù meaning its rented for 2 people but its not even a queen bed -or- ‚Äúrustic‚Äù surroundings meaning a junkyard is on the same block as where you are staying. 

Also, app navigation has never been that intuitive. I still find myself vetting stuck in places and starti g the app over. It is as if they never really knew what a ‚Äúback button‚Äù was. 

In the end, I have had many good experiences and one or two exceptional ones, all being because the host made it so. 

March 2020 entry

The app has definitely gotten better with a few issues remaining. Receipts can be viewed but not printed, emailed, or otherwise utilized in any way!?? House rules seem to be more dodgy than ever. Sometimes they are easily found, sometimes theyare emailed after a reservation and almost all are rants of disorganized personalities ü§™ . Airbnb survives because of really cool people hosting the coolest and most diverse amenities ever offered. Airbnb serves this market with an average score of 3 stars. App now cuts off text messages and inhibits return messages even inside the app. Het twice the messages tou cannot respond to. Cool! Just keeps getting worse! This app is different but not better Has the search by map been removed or moved where I can't find it?? Why is taking longer to find more unavailable properties? Just updated again to try features and tools. App freezes... App is still clunky but better than it was but I just got recommended stays a surprising distance from my intended destination..... The app is worse than ever and the whole AIRBNB system is getting to be a frustrating mess. I have attempted to book 5 locations in the last 6 months with one success. After a major frustration I was offered over $100 instant credits and still chose not to book with AIR BNB...... This is getting unfriendlier and more "corporate" by the day. Earlier version .... Whoever released this needs to roll it back up! I have attempted to book stays with complete frustration and mix ups. The app has reversed it performance of user ease. Avoid this new version....

title: Isn‚Äôt working
text: It said to update so I did and now it‚Äôs just a black screen

title: Airbnb costs are ridiculous
text: $300 a night? lol, don‚Äôt forget $160 Airbnb fees, $150 taxes, and of course the $250 cleaning fee. Airbnb rates are a joke and so many renters know it and offer their properties on other sites or on personal pages for much less. I doubt you‚Äôll ever find your best deal here.

title: Anti-handicap bigots
text: Airbnb refused to give my handicap mother a refund, even though the property we tried to rent from Stuart Morley was not handicap accessible! There wasn't even room for my mom's wheelchair anywhere and we only stayed a few days out of the 25 that we reserved. Airbnb has this individual to steal from us with no ability to recover the money and the trip interruption insurance they offer is worthless too, and didn't cover anything! Don't ever use this service or you'll lose your money and never be able to get it back. They purposely allow people that they are being prejudiced towards handicap people to continue to be on there and make money from their service. Airbnb is a bunch of thieves.

title: Won‚Äôt open
text: Since New update, the app will not open on my phone. Just rotates the app symbol.

title: Great alternative when traveling with dogs
text: Most of my personal travel is with my four-legged friend. It is so much easier and less expensive to use AirBNB instead of hotel chains.  Occasionally I use it for business travel when I am looking for a specific area and can‚Äôt find a hotel.

title: Damage fee SCAMS
text: I had always heard from friends how Airbnb scams its customers and it happened to me too. I was held responsible for existing damages in a cabinet and was charged $150 for the chipped corner paint. I have many other friends telling me how the hosts show repair documentation and they go and proceed to over charge for existing damages in a property and they try to hold you responsible for it.

title: Proof That Evil Will Prevail
text: THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT YOUR SAFETY, AS LONG AS THEY MAKE MONEY OFF OF YOU. NARROWLY ESCAPED A DANGEROUS SITUATION. I recently experienced a concerning situation during a reservation with Airbnb, prompting me to share a cautionary tale with fellow users. Regrettably, my experience has led me to conclude that Airbnb‚Äôs commitment to customer safety may not align with their public image. Despite raising genuine safety concerns during my stay and providing detailed information, the response from Airbnb‚Äôs support team exhibited a lack of thorough consideration and logical coherence. The decision-making process appeared flawed, with the introduction of logical fallacies and an apparent disregard for the gravity of the issues raised. This experience has left me deeply dissatisfied with Airbnb‚Äôs customer service, as it seems the platform prioritizes financial transactions over the safety and well-being of its users. Consequently, I have chosen to discontinue using Airbnb for future accommodations. I urge potential users to exercise caution when considering Airbnb for their lodging needs. While the platform may offer a wide array of options, my unfortunate commitment to addressing safety concerns promptly and responsibly. It is essential for users to be aware that Airbnb‚Äôs customer support may fall short of expectations when faced with issues that require careful consideration and thorough investigation. The logical fallacies evident in their response, including appeals to ignorance, non sequiturs, and hasty generalizations, highlight a concerning lack of rigor in their decision-making process. Such lapses in reasoning raise questions about the reliability of Airbnb‚Äôs customer support and their ability to handle situations that involve safety and security. In light of these experiences, I strongly caution potential users against relying solely on Airbnb for their lodging needs. Exploring alternative accommodation options with a reputation for prioritizing customer safety and providing robust support mechanisms might be a more prudent choice. While Airbnb has undoubtedly revolutionized the way we travel and seek accommodations, my recent encounter has revealed a disconcerting aspect of their customer service that cannot be overlooked. As consumers, our safety and well-being should remain paramount, and I believe it is crucial to consider these factors when choosing a platform for lodging arrangements. In conclusion, my recommendation is to approach Airbnb with caution and to carefully evaluate their commitment to safety and customer support. It is my hope that this review serves as a reminder for users to prioritize platforms that consistently uphold the highest standards of service and safety.

title: Very Satisfied
text: App is very easy to use

title: Reality
text: It is nice to book and enjoy experiences but let‚Äôs hope nothing detrimental occurs because they have no resolution or policies for refunds

title: Used to be a good service
text: I used to love using Airbnb, now there is a ridiculous amount of fees added at the end and the total ends up being 3 or 4 times the advertised price. This kind of false advertising is very disappointing as Airbnb used to be much more transparent. There is a button you can select that gives you a closer number to what you will ultimately pay.  But I don‚Äôt like being tricked into a false sense of security by these fake prices.

title: Usability Issues
text:
To be clear, LOVE the service. This review is of the app's usability as a visually impaired person.

Text (as in 'how to get in' messages) cannot be zoomed in on. Nor can it be copied by a long press. This forces you into all sorts of cludgy work-arounds.

As noted, love the service but make the app more user friendly.

title: Terrible support for hosts
text:
I‚Äôm a host with three years‚Äô experience on Airbnb. In general, it was OK, but when I got a scammer guest who reserved in the wrong place and then lied and said my place was dirty, in order to cancel the reservation and get her money back, the support from Airbnb customer service was terrible. Though I was a ‚ÄúSuperHost‚Äù with all five-star ratings, they believed the guest and gave her all her money back.
I recently tried returning to Airbnb but found the customer service is still inadequate. They give you the runaround endlessly, seemingly trying to wear you out, rather than help you. I am done with hosting on Airbnb. I recommend using FurnishedFinder.Com. They don‚Äôt take a percentage of your rent, but rather a yearly fee of about $150.

title: Scam
text: If you get a bad air bnb rental don‚Äôt expect any help from air bnb. Scammers!

title: A good way to lose a lot of money.
text: AirBnB is one of those services that when it works well and everyone involved is being honest is wonder but the moment you have a disreputable host you can lose a massive amount of money. I had a host mislead me on a listing and when I found out less than 48 hours later and attempted to cancel I was met with a 900 dollar cancelation fee, when I tried to contact AirBnB I was met with a we will reach out to the host and the host refused to give me my money back. Airbnb told me that it was up to the host who had mislead me in the listing to begin with. The real shame is that there are good and honest hosts but the fact that predatory ones are allowed to continue doing business makes it impossible for me to even consider continuing business with them.

title: How we still believe Airbnb
text:
The house owner used old item blame us for damage and charge me for damage which we never use and that item not even in my room. The review are fake. You can see one person put multiple 5 stars review make it looks like perfect place. 
Double charge for cleaning fee. Why we are still using Airbnb?

title: Insulting way of conducting business
text:
When you have to book a reservation, it‚Äôs very easy, one click , submit , it‚Äôs all over. 
Now, when you wanna cancel a reservation it‚Äôs endless loop of questions that don‚Äôt make any sense , on and on and on. This is not a problem only with Airbnb only but it‚Äôs a problem with wast majority of apps out there. It‚Äôs pathetic and it‚Äôs straight up insulting. Never again.

title: poor customer service
text:
it is THE WORST customer service experience of any app. they use a call center in India, that is probably a room of 500 people, all talking at the same time, so you can not hear your representative. the representatives barely speak any English, so you can not understand anything they say. imagine, you are calling probably one of the worst places in the world for customer service.
try it for yourself.

title: NIGHTMARE STAY
text: I‚Äôve used this app to host and stay. Their customer service is extremely useless in helping hosts and guests with stays. There‚Äôs no accountability from AIRBnB and they are quick to give you a run around. They don‚Äôt count a ton of small black hairs on a bed as UNSANITARY! Disgusting. Save yourself the nightmare and don‚Äôt use AIRbnb.

title: AirBNB removes negative reviews
text: My sisters and I used is app to book a home for our vacation. The listing was not at all as described, advertised as a whole home and it was an old messy upstairs unit of a multifamily complex. Our review and the people who booked below us were both negative and AirBnB removed all negative reviews. Shady customer service and shady hosts ruin this platform.

title: ROACHES
text: My most recent stay in Kissimmee Florida had roaches an Airbnb did nothing about it. I submitted photos of the roaches an they told me verbatim we are sorry but we can only give you a 10% refund for the first night. Which is $13. Pathetic

title: Horrible customer service
text: I had an issue with one of the Airbnb I booked and didn‚Äôt get no help at all they were keep hanging up my call or transferring it to each other and asking me the same questions. The customer service is run in a third party so good luck getting any help. Really bad experience.

title: No support
text:
If you want to go for cheap renovations, old funky furniture, sketchy entrances and no assistance come here!
Aibnb offers no customer support. If you have terrible host or a terrible experience Airbnb will offer you no help, they will stand for the host, and if the host do no want to cancel or refund you will have to take the financial damage or ruin your trip.
Save yourself stress and disappointment, book a hotel, they have someone at the door 24h, professional service, and customer service.

I am someone who travels very often, I am NEVER using Airbnb again.
